intro: Agathophytum ambrosioides, commonly known as the Mexican rue or wormseed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dark-colored seeds that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, often pungent aroma. Agathophytum ambrosioides is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and historical significance.
